Sam Harden

Sam Harden

Lawyer / Fullstack Developer / Legal Technology Optimist

About me:

I'm a lawyer who decided to teach himself to code, because I'm a believer that technology can help bridge the access-to-justice gap. I work primarily in Python, but have also worked in Go and NodeJS.

I'm constantly building and experimenting with ways to apply technology to law. Check out my github repo for examples of what I've built.

My work:

I work with vLex, a global legal research company, Measures for Justice, and the Florida Justice Technology Center.

Docassemble videos:

I've been creating instructional videos about how to set up and use Docassemble, the open-source document assembly program. You can check out the YouTube channel.

Blog

The FJTC is Dead

Long Live the FJTC

Posted on October 9, 2019

On September 30 the Florida Justice Technology Center effectively shut down. I worked as a Project Manager then as Dev Team Leader for the FJTC for nearly two years. I left the FJTC in August to work with the legal research company vLex. [Read More]
